questions.question_text: A finance group recently implemented new technologies and processes. Which type of IS audit would provide the GREATEST level of assurance that the department's objectives have been met?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Given that the finance group has implemented new technologies and processes, an integrated audit is the most suitable choice because it will assess both the financial and IT aspects of these changes, ensuring that the department's objectives are being met in a controlled and compliant manner.

Selected Answer: B
An integrated audit is a comprehensive audit of different functions or departments across the organization, whereas a performance audit is more appropriate to assess the achievement of objectives of a particular department.Hence, to ascertain the achievement of objectives of the finance group, a performance audit is the most appropriate type of IS audit.

questions.question_text: The PRIMARY focus of a post-implementation review is to verify that:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
During the post-implementation review, careful attention should be paid to the end users’ utilization, trouble tickets, work orders and overall satisfaction with the system. This will indicate whether the system’s objectives and requirements were achieved.

Selected Answer: B
B. user requirements have been met.

The primary focus of a post-implementation review is to verify that user requirements have been met (Option B). A post-implementation review assesses whether the system, application, or project delivers the intended functionality and value to meet the needs and expectations of the users. This involves evaluating whether the implemented solution aligns with the initial requirements and specifications and whether any deviations or gaps exist. While other options, such as compliance with enterprise architecture and user access controls, are important considerations, the primary goal is to ensure that user requirements are satisfied.

questions.question_text: An auditee disagrees with a recommendation for corrective action that appears in the draft engagement report. Which of the following is the IS auditor's BEST course of action when preparing the final report?

discussion.content:
Option A is the correct answer. The IS auditor should work with the auditee to understand their objections and seek to reach an agreement that is satisfactory to both parties. The final engagement report should reflect the agreed-upon findings and recommendations, along with any necessary modifications or clarifications.

Options B, C, and D are not appropriate in this scenario. Ensuring the auditee's comments are included in the working papers is important, but it does not address the issue of the disputed recommendation in the final report. Excluding the disputed recommendation from the final engagement report may compromise the integrity and completeness of the audit findings. Including the position supported by senior management in the final engagement report may be inappropriate and compromise the independence and objectivity of the audit function.

Selected Answer: A
Including the position supported by senior management in the final engagement report (option D) may be appropriate in some cases, but it should not be the default course of action if there is a disagreement with the auditee. Prioritizing open communication, negotiation, and consensus-building is essential for maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of the audit process. Therefore, coming to an agreement prior to issuing the final report is the best approach for the IS auditor.
